item.title: Alleged scam targeted rich suburbs
item.description: Three UK and Irish citizens are accused of ripping $425,000 off trusting elderly targets who lived alone, in a con job operating throughout Melbourne between March and July.

item.title: Top cop’s hardline virus stance
item.description: NSW Police officers have been given a strong directive to stop issuing warnings and start writing tickets to those caught breaching health orders.

item.title: First judge-only trial delivers not guilty verdict
item.description: Two accused Melbourne “crop sitters” have been found not guilty in Victoria’s first ever judge-only trial.

item.title: Aus Post worker tests positive
item.description: A worker at an Australia Post delivery centre in Melbourne’s west has tested positive for coronavirus.

item.title: Why senior police officer was stood down
item.description: The Queensland Police Minister has defended the temporary standing down of one of the state’s senior officers while allegations of domestic violence are investigated.

item.title: Drones bust winery’s illegal storage
item.description: The state’s environmental watchdog has used drones to uncover open pits of illegally dumped industrial waste at a regional Victorian winery.

item.title: Vasiljevic chases NBA dream via Kings
item.description: The opportunity to develop into an NBA-ready talent was the major reason rising sharpshooter Dejan Vasiljevic signed a three-year deal with the Sydney Kings.

item.title: Only 2 of 150,000 cars punted at border
item.description: Only two travellers from more than 150,000 cars have been penalised trying to cross into NSW from Victoria without a valid reason since the border was closed last week.

item.title: PM and Trump compare notes on the virus
item.description: Prime Minister Scott Morrison and Donald Trump have “compared notes” on managing the coronavirus crisis.

item.title: ‘Worrying’ question experts can’t answer
item.description: The sharp rise in infections around Melbourne is not yet proof that the virus is “out of control”, experts say, but it will be a different story if cases don’t stop climbing over the next in the next two days.
